result.execSummary:
The defendant Nestor G Villanueva Almanza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will allow the defendant to request expungement after 6 months if all fines and costs are paid and no other criminal violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nestor G Villanueva Almanza

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on June 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.
FTP Hearing June 26, 2017, for $705.00
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

10:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joseph Schuessler.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter sworn.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 3 with a fine and costs and counts 1 & 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Schuessler concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court questions defendant regarding interpreter.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 3 as charged and orders counts 1 & 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Schuessler.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-$200 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court will allow the defendant to request expungement after 6 months if all fines and costs are paid and no other criminal violations.

Court adjourned at 10:43 a.m.
Status hearing on April 25, 2017 at 10:30 am.

10:36 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joseph Schuessler present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuessler - does not know where the defendant is.  Court sets for Status Hearing Mandatory appearance on April 25, 2017 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:37 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 10:15 am.

11:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joseph Schuessler.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuessler - very close to an agreement and need more time to discuss with the defendant.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on March 28, 2017 at 10:15 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 11:45 a.m.
State's
Status hearing on February 28, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Atty Schuessler called, has a conflict with the 02/21 court date and requests this matter be rescheduled.  Matter rescheduled to February 28, 2017 at 11:30 a.m.  New notice to be sent.

Court adjourned at 1:52 p.m.
on Petition for Appointment of An Attorney (denied)

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant stands mute. Court enters plea of NOT GUILTY on his behalf. Court notes bond has been set. Court will set for Status Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 a.m .

Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel

Corut finds probable cause for the charges.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.  Defendant to return to court on July 19, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. for Initial Appearance.
